snippet: The organizers denied charges of wrongdoing after a British newspaper reported that a former FIFA vice president paid top soccer officials to build support for Qatar’s bid.
abstract: Organizers of the 2022 World Cup in Qatar deny allegations of wrongdoing in response to report in Sunday Times of London accusing former FIFA vice president Mohamed bin Hammam of bribing top soccer officials to build support for Qatar's bid.
lead_paragraph: The organizers denied charges of wrongdoing after a British newspaper reported that a former FIFA vice president paid top soccer officials to build support for Qatar’s bid.

headline.main: World Cup Corruption Accusation Is Disputed
headline.print_headline: World Cup Corruption Accusation Is Disputed
